SEARCH
Package no.ntnu.idatt1005.foodi.model.daos

Class QueryBuilder

java.lang.Object
no.ntnu.idatt1005.foodi.model.daos.QueryBuilder
public class QueryBuilder extends Object
A helper class for building SQL queries. 
 Ingredient i =  new QueryBuilder("SELECT * FROM ingredient WHERE id = ?")
         .addInt(5) // the id of the ingredient
         .executeQuerySafe(rs -> {
           if (rs.next()) {
             // code to create an ingredient object
             return new Ingredient(...);
           }
           return null;
         });
Version:
1.0
Author:
Leif MÃ¸rstad

    A functional interface for modifying a PreparedStatement parameter at a given index.
    static interface 
    QueryBuilder.ThrowingConsumer<T>
    A functional interface for consuming a value and throwing an exception.

    • parts

      private final ArrayList<QueryBuilder.StatementModifier> parts
      A list of methods to modify the statement.

    • locked

      private boolean locked
      Whether the query is locked or not. After the query is run, the statement is locked and the query parameters can no longer be modified.

    • executeQuerySafe

      @Nullable public <T> T executeQuerySafe(@NotNull @NotNull QueryBuilder.ResultHandler<ResultSet,T> handler)
      Executes a SELECT query and returns the result without throwing if it encounters an error. Returns null if it does.
      Returns:
      The result of the query. Returns null if the query throws.
      See Also:
      • PreparedStatement.executeQuery()
      • executeQuery(ResultHandler)

    • executeQuery

      public <T> T executeQuery(@NotNull @NotNull QueryBuilder.ResultHandler<ResultSet,T> handler) throws SQLException
      Executes a SELECT query and returns the result through a handler function.
      Returns:
      The result of the query.
      Throws:
      SQLException - If an error occurs while executing the query.
      See Also:
      • PreparedStatement.executeQuery()

    • runAndThenReturnWithMethod

      private <StatementT, ReturnT> ReturnT runAndThenReturnWithMethod(@NotNull @NotNull QueryBuilder.StatementMethod<StatementT> method, @NotNull @NotNull QueryBuilder.ResultHandler<StatementT,ReturnT> handler) throws SQLException
      Runs the given method on the query and returns the result. Running it locks the query. The handler param should not return ResultSet, as this might cause a resource leak, but if needed for a hack remember to ResultSet.close() it after use.
      Type Parameters:
      StatementT - The return type of the statement.
      ReturnT - The return type of the method.
      Parameters:
      method - The method to run.
      handler - The handler to handle the result.
      Throws:
      SQLException - If an error occurs while running the query.
